name: ITP - B1101A - Te Ngarue Bridge - Asphalt - Rev2
template name: ITP - B1101A - Te Ngarue Bridge - Asphalt - Rev2

name: Detail - Confirm site extents by checking what’s marked on the road matches the job sheet / Design Report
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Mark out on site
Detail - Milling undertaken to correct depth of nominal thickness
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Maeasurements
Detail - To comply with NZTA M01: 2020 - Table 6.1
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Property Test
Conformance Criteria - NZTA M01: 2020 - Table 6.1, TNZ P11: 2007 - Table 5.2 Lab Mix Design Volumetric and Physical requirements
Detail - To comply with NZTA M10 - Refer to Section 2
Frequency - Testing frequency shall be in accordance with CCNZ BPG05 Quality Assurance of Aggregates.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Table 2.1 in NZTA M10
Detail - To comply with NZTA M10 - Refer to Section 2
Frequency - Testing frequency shall be in accordance with CCNZ BPG05 Quality Assurance of Aggregates.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Table 2.2 in NZTA M10
Detail - Determine paving run start/stop locations
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Survey, Visual Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Ensure accurate survey setting out is in place.
Detail - Ensure weather conditions are acceptable for work to proceed
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Weather Forecast
Conformance Criteria - Wearing course asphalt shall not be placed when the pavement surface temperature is less than 10°C
Detail - Ensure previous layer is broomed clean.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Truck broom to have been used and surface approved by CPS Engineer
Detail - Application as per Design Requirements (Chip size / binder application rate)
Frequency - Prior to asphalt, Spray sheet for everyday.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Spray sheet, QA records
Conformance Criteria - Application as per Design Requirements (Chip size / binder application rate)
Detail - The temperature of the asphalt shall enable compaction required to achieve air voids %..
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Temperature Check
Conformance Criteria - The asphalt shall have a minimum temperature of 80 degrees Celsius on completion of compaction.
Detail - Layer thickness measured from core samples.
Frequency - Each core taken for density
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Core Test
Conformance Criteria - ±5mm nominal thickness as shown in the Drawings, Plans and/or Specifications
Detail - To comply with NZTA M10: or project specification
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - NDM for Quality Control Only
Detail - No visible cracks, defects related to poorly constructed joints, water ponding,
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual inspection.
Conformance Criteria - No visible crack, no obvious defect related to poorly constructed joints. No areas with water ponding. Good ride quality.
Detail - The Construction Walkover must be scheduled at least one week before the site's completion or demobilisation.
○ Walkover must be attended by Quality, CPS & Construction (other parties might be invited e.g. Resource consent close out)
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Construction Walkover Report: with date, list of attendees and full defect/snag list.
○ Defect List closed by Final Approver or Transferred to Master Snag List.
Conformance Criteria - Visual Inspection, Quality Site Inspection Report (QSIR)
Records - Walkover Report (COR or QSIR), Procore Defect List
Detail - Redline mark-up drawings are to be reviewed and accepted by CPS.
○ A survey of completed work must be requested and completed by the survey team.
Frequency - At the completion of the ITP of work
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - All RFI, NCRs and site changes must be recorded on the red-line drawing.
Conformance Criteria - Closed ABMS, Survey Confirmation
Records - Redline Markups, Closed ABMS, Survey Confirmation
Detail - Redline mark-up drawings are to be reviewed and accepted by CPS.
○ All NCRs and RFIs are closed and included with the Handover QA file.
Frequency - At the completion of the ITP
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Ensure all QA is uploaded into Procore
Records - NCRs, RFI's, Approved Redline mark-ups
Detail - Signoffs by Project Manager, Quality Manager and CPS Manager
Frequency - At the completion of the ITP
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Ensure all parties have signed and approved the ITP QA records as being complete.
